com.qualitestgroup.kdt

Class Keyword

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualitestgroup.kdt.Keyword
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Browser.Close, Browser.Launch, Browser.NavigateTo, Browser.NavigateToApplicationUnderTest, Common.AddDaysToCurrentDateExcludeWeekends, Common.Concatenate, Common.GetCurrentDateTime, Common.GoTo, Common.MoveDirectory, Common.Pause, Common.Print, Common.RepeatKeyword, Common.RetrieveGlobal, Common.RetrieveLocal, Common.Screenshot, Common.StoreGlobal, Common.StoreLocal, Common.Validate, Common.Wait, CPQ.AccountSearchByName, CPQ.AddFirstProductToQuote, CPQ.AddQuoteToOpportunity, CPQ.CancelAccountCreation, CPQ.CancelContactCreation, CPQ.EditAccount, CPQ.EditContact, CPQ.EditOpportunity, CPQ.EditQuoteAddedToOpportunity, CPQ.EnterAccountMandatoryDetails, CPQ.EnterContactMandatoryDetails, CPQ.EnterOpportunitiesMandatoryDetails, CPQ.EnterQuoteMandatoryDetails, CPQ.LoginToApplication, CPQ.LogoutOfApplication, CPQ.SaveAccountDetails, CPQ.SaveAndNewAccount, CPQ.SaveAndNewContact, CPQ.SaveContactDetails, CPQ.SaveEditedOpportunity, CPQ.SaveOpportunitiesDetails, CPQ.SaveQuoteDetails, CPQ.SelectAccountRecordType, CPQ.SelectContactRecordType, CPQ.SelectOpportunitiesRecordType, CPQ.SelectQuoteRecordType, CPQ.ValidateErrorMessage, Database.Connect, Database.ConnectionKeyword, Database.ExecuteQuery, WebService.AppendIdToUrl, WebService.AppendPkgIdToUrl, WebService.GetHttpConnection

    public abstract class Keyword
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for keywords. Implementing classes must provide override the exec function. The init and cleanup methods can be overridden to provide more functionality.
    Author:
    lenovo

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
          throws KDTKeywordInitException
        Initializes the keyword. Implementing classes should override this method to validate arguments and check keyword preconditions. It is recommended that this superclass method be called in overriding implementations.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments for this keyword
        Throws:
        KDTKeywordInitException - Keyword initialization exception.

      • exec

        public abstract void exec()
                   throws KDTKeywordExecException
        Executes the keyword.
        Throws:
        KDTKeywordExecException

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
        Cleans up after the keyword. This is called even if init or exec fail.

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup(java.lang.Exception e)
        Cleans up after the keyword. This is called even if init or exec fail.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception raised during init or exec

      • run

        public final void run()
               throws KDTException
        Runs the keyword. The init, exec, and cleanup methods
        Throws:
        KDTException

      • addArg

        public final void addArg(java.lang.String argName,
                         java.lang.String argValue)

      • find

        @Deprecated
public static final Keyword find(java.lang.String keyword,
                                              java.lang.String app)
                                       throws KDTParseException
        Deprecated. 
        Throws:
        KDTParseException

      • run

        public static final Keyword run(java.lang.String application,
                                java.lang.String keyword,
                                java.lang.String... args)
                         throws KDTException
        Runs a keyword.
        Parameters:
        application - The Application (KeywordGroup) containing the keyword.
        keyword - The name of the keyword.
        args - Arguments for the keyword. Alternates between Name and Value (Name1, Value1, Name2, Value2, ...)
        Throws:
        KDTException - If the keyword can't be found, the number of args is odd, or the keyword throws an error.
